definition: to let go/to loosen one's grip/to put sth down
to explain/to release/Buddha (abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2])/Buddhism
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to love sth too much to part with it (idiom); to fondle admiringly

sentences.english: I could not tear myself away from the novel.
sentences.chinese: 這本小說讓我不忍釋手。

sentences.english: He was enthusing about his new radio.
sentences.chinese: 他對自己的新收音機愛不釋手。

sentences.english: He was enthusing about his new pocket cassette recorder.
sentences.chinese: 他對自己的新袖珍錄音機愛不釋手。

sentences.english: Read it, I know you will love it.
sentences.chinese: 捧讀它吧，我敢打賭你一定會愛不釋手。

sentences.english: There was so much to love about the new desktop.
sentences.chinese: 新的桌面有太多的東西讓人愛不釋手了。

sentences.english: The red rose is a cup of attractive good wine to the mature man.
sentences.chinese: 紅玫瑰對成熟的男人來講，是愛不釋手的酒。

sentences.english: However, the thing that your person often fondles admiringly is not beautiful certainly however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，令人往往愛不釋手的東西卻並不一定都是美的。

sentences.english: Parents love newborn, often holding to embrace to fondle admiringly.
sentences.chinese: 父母疼愛新生兒，往往抱來抱去，愛不釋手。

sentences.english: Thank you for the Milestone, it's really unputdownable to me.
sentences.chinese: 謝謝你送我里程碑，這一次我愛不釋手。

sentences.english: George is mad about his new saxophone.
sentences.chinese: 喬治對他的新薩克斯風愛不釋手。

sentences.english: This well-tailored fashionaBle dress in sophisticated coloring can certainly make you touch it admiringly .
sentences.chinese: 這件時裝精緻的色彩，典雅的裁剪定會使您愛不釋手。

sentences.english: People say (that)this book is a page-turner.
sentences.chinese: 人們說這本書讓人愛不釋手。
